abstract: Lai Sai-ming, captain of passenger ferry that collided with another vessel in 2012, killing 39 people in one of Hong Kong's worst maritime disasters, is convicted of 39 counts of manslaughter; Chow Chi-wai, captain of other boat, receives lesser charge of endangering safety of others at sea.
lead_paragraph: The captain of another vessel involved in a 2012 maritime disaster, Hong Kong’s worst in decades, was acquitted of manslaughter Saturday but convicted on a lesser charge.

headline.main: Ferry Captain Is Convicted in Hong Kong
headline.print_headline: Ferry Captain Is Convicted in Hong Kong

snippet: The captain of another vessel involved in a 2012 maritime disaster, Hong Kong’s worst in decades, was acquitted of manslaughter Saturday but convicted on a lesser charge.
